alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Cherokee; Houston; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 5:12AM CDT until March 25 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Texas... Neches River Near Alto affecting Cherokee, Houston, Anderson and Trinity Counties. For the Neches River...including Alto...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River Near Alto, Texas. * WHEN...From early this Wednesday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment near the river to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.6 feet this Wednesday morning and then will recede below flood stage late this Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 645 AM CDT.
